segment.source: Offer consumable in-app products—items that can be purchased, used, and purchased again—through the Store commerce platform to provide your customers with a purchase experience that is both robust and reliable.
segment.target: Offer consumable in-app products—items that can be purchased, used, and purchased again—through the Store commerce platform to provide your customers with a purchase experience that is both robust and reliable.

segment.source: This is especially useful for things like in-game currency (gold, coins, etc.) that can be purchased and then used to purchase specific power-ups.

segment.source: This topic covers the purchase and fulfillment reporting of consumable in-app products.
segment.target: This topic covers the purchase and fulfillment reporting of consumable in-app products.

segment.source: If you are unfamiliar with in-app products, please review Enable in-app product purchases to learn about license information, and how to properly list in-app products in the Store.
segment.target: If you are unfamiliar with in-app products, please review Enable in-app product purchases to learn about license information, and how to properly list in-app products in the Store.

segment.source: When you code and test new in-app products for the first time, you must use the CurrentAppSimulator object instead of the CurrentApp object.
segment.target: When you code and test new in-app products for the first time, you must use the CurrentAppSimulator object instead of the CurrentApp object.

segment.source: This way you can verify your license logic using simulated calls to the license server instead of calling the live server.
segment.target: This way you can verify your license logic using simulated calls to the license server instead of calling the live server.

segment.source: To do this, you need to customize the file named "WindowsStoreProxy.xml" in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\package name\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.
segment.target: To do this, you need to customize the file named "WindowsStoreProxy.xml" in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\package name\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.

segment.source: Step 1: Making the purchase request
segment.target: Step 1: Making the purchase request

segment.source: The initial purchase request is made with RequestProductPurchaseAsync like any other purchase made through the Store.
segment.target: The initial purchase request is made with RequestProductPurchaseAsync like any other purchase made through the Store.

segment.source: The difference for consumable in-app products is that after a successful purchase, a customer cannot purchase the same product again until the app has notified the Store that the previous purchase was successfully fulfilled.
segment.target: The difference for consumable in-app products is that after a successful purchase, a customer cannot purchase the same product again until the app has notified the Store that the previous purchase was successfully fulfilled.

segment.source: It's your app's responsibility to fulfill purchased consumables and notify the Store of the fulfillment.
segment.target: It's your app's responsibility to fulfill purchased consumables and notify the Store of the fulfillment.

segment.target: You'll notice code comments indicating when your app should conduct its local fulfillment of the consumable in-app product for two different scenarios—when the request is successful, and when the request is not successful because of an unfulfilled purchase of that same product.

segment.target: Step 2: Tracking local fulfillment of the consumable

segment.source: When granting your customer access to the consumable in-app product, it's important to keep track of which product is fulfilled (productId), and which transaction that fulfillment is associated with (transactionId).
segment.target: When granting your customer access to the consumable in-app product, it's important to keep track of which product is fulfilled (productId), and which transaction that fulfillment is associated with (transactionId).

segment.source: Step 3: Reporting product fulfillment to the Store
segment.target: Step 3: Reporting product fulfillment to the Store

segment.source: After local fulfillment is completed, your app must make a ReportConsumableFulfillmentAsync call that includes the productId and the transaction the product purchase is included in.
segment.target: After local fulfillment is completed, your app must make a ReportConsumableFulfillmentAsync call that includes the productId and the transaction the product purchase is included in.

segment.source: Important Failure to report fulfilled consumable in-app products to the Store will result in the user being unable to purchase that product again until fulfillment for the previous purchase is reported.
segment.target: Important Failure to report fulfilled consumable in-app products to the Store will result in the user being unable to purchase that product again until fulfillment for the previous purchase is reported.

segment.source: Step 4: Identifying unfulfilled purchases
segment.target: Step 4: Identifying unfulfilled purchases

segment.source: Your app can use the GetUnfulfilledConsumablesAsync method to check for unfulfilled consumable in-app products at any time.
segment.target: Your app can use the GetUnfulfilledConsumablesAsync method to check for unfulfilled consumable in-app products at any time.

segment.source: This method should be called on a regular basis to check for unfulfilled consumables that exist due to unanticipated app events like an interruption in network connectivity or app termination.
segment.target: This method should be called on a regular basis to check for unfulfilled consumables that exist due to unanticipated app events like an interruption in network connectivity or app termination.
